locutie.beschrijving: The preacher narrates a personal anecdote about Easter in NYC, provides an exegetical retelling of Thomas's doubt and encounter with Jesus, and reflects on the nature of faith versus sight.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: Strong narrative flow; correctly identifies the climax of the Fourth Gospel in Thomas's confession.

illocutie.beschrijving: The preacher primarily asserts historical and theological truths, but shifts to a declarative beatitude at the end.
voorbeelden: I have a vivid memory of the first Easter Sunday...
Thomas was a believer in Murphy’s law...
Blessed are they who have not seen and yet have believed.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To move the hearer from skepticism or 'vague belief' to personal trust in the Risen Christ.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Implicit; the preacher acknowledges he has 'nothing to show' but the 'gift of faith' which implies the Spirit's work.

voorbeelden: The Newsweek article is the best.
The church was not built on seeing with the eyes.
I have always envied the way...
My heart lifted, more than I can find words to say.
What I have I give you.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Weak; the preacher offers his witness rather than a direct divine promise.

voorbeelden: Blessed are they who have not seen...
declaratieven.autoriteit: High at the conclusion, as the preacher mediates Christ's beatitude.

indicatoren: Extensive personal narrative about NYC (6 paragraphs)
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer is an observer of the preacher's memories and Thomas's history rather than a participant in the event.

performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: Hearer remains in the 'waiting room' of faith until the final beatitude.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: The beatitude functions as the primary promise.
voorbeelden: The risen Lord looks at you this very day... and says, 'Blessed are they...'

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Dominates the first half; used for personal storytelling.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Used in the conclusion to apply the text.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Used for the exegesis of Thomas and the newsmagazines.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a narrative distance that is only closed in the final moments.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: General truths about faith and newsmagazines.

actueel_present.gebruik: The 'now' of the chapel and the risen Lord's address.

voorbeelden: The risen Lord looks at you... and says, 'Blessed...'
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: The transition is late but powerful.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: Because Christ is risen, you are blessed.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon moves from a long narrative 'talking about' Easter to a final moment of 'proclaiming' the blessing of Christ to the hearer.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The risen Lord looks at you this very day...

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The long description of NYC traffic and Carnation Instant Breakfast.
zwakke_punten.probleem: Delays the illocutionary force of the Gospel.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It becomes an event only in the final three paragraphs; prior to that, it is a high-quality lecture/memoir.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The preacher acts as a witness but hesitates to use the full authority of the 'Mandataris' until the very end.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: Yes, at the end, the preacher lets Christ speak the beatitude.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Partially; he identifies as a 'merely human witness'.
tekstueel_bewijs: Through the word of this merely human witness, the risen Lord looks at you.

pneumatologie.geest_rol_erkend: Implicitly, through the mention of the 'gift of faith'.
pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Yes, faith is described as a gift given, not a work performed.
tekstueel_bewijs: what I have I give you... the gift of faith.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: The sermon aims to be a means of grace by delivering the blessing of Christ.
sacramentstheologie.epifanisch_taalgebruik: The description of David Crum in the doorway functions as a 'secular epiphany'.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is heavy on past-tense assertives. It needs more present-tense commissives.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: The church was not built on seeing with the eyes.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Christ does not ask you to see; He gives you His Word.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Shifts from a historical fact to a present address.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The promise is buried at the very end.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Interweave the beatitude throughout the Thomas narrative.
voorbeeldzinnen: Even as Thomas doubts, Christ is preparing a blessing for you.

adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Reduce the NYC anecdote to increase the 'You' address.
voorbeeldzinnen: You, like Thomas, may feel the doors are locked.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The balance is actually good; the indicative is strong.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A beautifully written sermon that successfully transitions from 'talking about' to 'proclaiming to' in its final act.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' (NYC story); SAT focuses on the 'Declarative' power of the Beatitude.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetoric would praise the vivid imagery; SAT asks if the 'blessing' actually happened.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the sermon's power is concentrated in the final paragraph where the illocutionary force shifts to a Declarative.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: The risen Lord looks at you this very day.

appendices.notities: The sermon relies heavily on the 'witness' model of homiletics.
